page.title: 17HOME LIFE IN STOCKSBRIDGE
page.content: FROM A CLASS OF 28 CHILDREN AT STOCKSBRIDGE JUNIOR SCHOOL, 5 HAVE COAL FIRES AT HOME AND 7 HAVE FIREGUARDS. 10 HOMES HAVE WINDOW LOCKS, 6 HAVE BURGLAR ALARMS AND 2 HAVE STAIRGATES. MOST CHILDREN HAVE DOMESTIC PETS, DOGS, CATS AND FISH BEING THE MOST POPULAR. FAMILY ACTIVITIES INVOLVE VISITING THE CINEMA, SWIMMING, WALKING, GOING TO CHURCH, SPEEDWAY, WATCHING TELEVISION AND PLAYING VIDEO GAMES. 4 CHILDREN DID NOT EAT BREAKFAST, BY CHOICE AND THE MAJORITY HAVE TOAST OR CEREALS. 3/4 STAY TO SCHOOL LUNCH. 1/2 HAVE A LIGHT TEA AS SOON AS THEY ARRIVE HOME FROM SCHOOL, WHILE THE OTHER HALF HAVE A COOKED MEAL WHEN ALL THE FAMILY ARE TOGETHER. NEARLY ALL HAD SUPPER.
